segment.documentation: BGM, A segment carrying the identity of the type of document and the reference number. In this case it would be the file reference number for tax control report.
DTM, This segment specifies the date and time of preparation of the Tax control message. Other dates related to the whole message may be specified at this point.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: This group is used to specify references that relate to the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, This segment identifies relevant references, such as the previous Tax control message between the trading partners.
DTM, This segment specifies the date and time of the reference in the preceding reference segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: This segment is used to identify the tax entities involved in the interchange. It could also be used to identify the controlling tax administration.

segment.documentation: NAD, This segment identifies the names and addresses of the two registered tax entities i.e. the sender and the recipient of the message. The segment may also identify the controlling tax administration.

RFF, This segment is used to send tax references which may identify the party specified in the preceding segment, such as a tax registration number issued by the relevant tax administration. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:
UNS, This segment separates the header information from the detailed control information. It will have the value D.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: This segment group carries all the control values.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment specifying the relevant reference numbers to identify the source file, i.e. the file that provides all data for the batch of related messages. This may be the file generation number and the file version number.
DTM, This segment may be used to give the date of preparation of the file identified in the preceding reference segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: This group identifies the type of tax related messages and specifies the control totals for each type.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to identify documents by transaction type, to enable the tax type and values within those documents to be summarized. For example, the segment would be used to specify credit notes in a separate occurrence from commercial invoices.
MOA, This segment gives the relevant monetary values per message type being summarised.
CNT, This segment gives relevant control quantities. In this case the number of documents of the type indicated in the preceding document/message details segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: This group identifies the type of tax and the relevant tax information relating to the type of tax for the batch of messages of the type specified in the preceding document/message details segment.

segment.documentation: TAX, This segment specifies the duty/tax category or type and relevant details, eg. tax percentage.

MOA, This segment gives the relevant monetary values relating to the tax type and rate identified in the tax segment. These will usually be:
- the total value of the goods and services (i.e. the amount on which the tax is assessed).
- the total tax monetary amount calculated for this tax type and rate.
